body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}


In this conversation, the agent's name is Bruce Williams and the customer's name is Laura Washington.  The conversation is about MetaCar (a Car Rental Agency ) and is a conversation about customer service.The customer is feeling {emotion}.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello! My name is Bruce Williams, and I’m with MetaCar, your go-to car rental agency.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Nice to meet you, Laura! How can I assist you today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Well, I'm feeling a bit frustrated with my recent rental experience.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: I’m really sorry to hear that, Laura. Could you please tell me the reservation number, if you have it?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Yes, it's one two three four five.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for that information. Also, may I have your email address to look up your details?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thanks, Laura! I'm pulling up your information now.

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Great, I hope you can resolve this issue.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Absolutely, I’ll do my best to assist you. Thank you for your patience.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for your time today, Laura. If you have any more questions, feel free to reach out!
